lcInstruction.p: The DITA OT requires Java. The SoureForge website includes the minimum Java requirements for each version of the DITA OT.
When you try to generate output, the DITA OT will alert you if your system does not meet the Java requirements. For the DITA OT, you will most likely need to download the Java Development Kit (JDK).

On Windows, you may see the following error message if your system does not meet the DITA OT’s Java requirements:“java.exe" is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.
On Mac, a pop-up window may appear indicating that you need a different version of Java and providing a link where you can download the correct version.
Follow the instructions below to ensure that your version of the JDK is up to date. Separate instructions are provided for Windows and Mac users.

step.cmd: Download and install the latest version of the Java Development Kit (JDK) from the Oracle website ().

info.note: At the time of this course’s release, the latest version of the JDK was version 8.

step.cmd: Open File Explorer, right-click on “This PC,” and then click “Properties.” A new window will open.
Click on the “Advanced System Settings” link in the left column of the new window. Another window will open.
Click on the “Environment Variables” button found in the lower right of the new window.
Find “JAVA_HOME” under the “System Variables” panel, and make sure that the value points to the directory where the JDK is installed.

taskbody.postreq: If “JAVA_HOME” does not exist, or exists but does not display the correct location, click “New...” and input JAVA_HOME under “Variable name” and the location of the JDK (for example, C:/Program Files/Java/[jdk_folder_name]) under “Variable value.”

step.cmd: Download and install the latest version of the Java Development Kit (JDK) from the Oracle website ().

info.note: At the time of this course’s release, the latest version of the JDK was version 8.

step.cmd: Make sure you click on “Accept License Agreement” when asked. A pop up will appear if you’ve clicked download without selecting “Accept.”
Under the download column select the Java link that is specific to your computer’s system.
step.info: Mac users choose MAC OS X.

step.cmd: Once it has downloaded, click on the icon in your downloads folder. A window will appear with instructions.
